Name: The Eternal Concert
Description: Rumors of sounds of a piano echoing in the rain seems to have attracted many curious visitors. Go investigate around the abandoned theater and find out the truth about this strange phenomenon.
QuestDesc: Rumors of sounds of a piano echoing in the rain seems to have attracted many curious visitors. Go investigate around the abandoned theater and find out the truth about this strange phenomenon.

Options.PlotLineKey: It's not safe for you to be standing here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Anxious Young Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aah! You scared me!

Options.PlotLineKey: Sorry. Were you looking for something?

Dialogues.Speaker: Anxious Young Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: *sigh* Guess I was just too worried.

Dialogues.Speaker: Anxious Young Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Look in the distance. See that valley? There's an abandoned music theater in the middle of it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Anxious Young Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My uncle. He went down there all by himself.

Options.PlotLineKey: It looks like a no man's land down there.

Dialogues.Speaker: Anxious Young Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ugh. Tell me about it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Anxious Young Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The area's been abandoned for years. Who knows what kind of stuff might be down there.

Dialogues.Speaker: Anxious Young Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wouldn't be surprised if you get crushed by a falling boulder or even have a building fall on top of you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Anxious Young Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But that stubborn old man. He even swung his fists at me when I told him I was going to go along with him...

Options.PlotLineKey: Why does he have to go down there?

Dialogues.Speaker: Anxious Young Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, you have no idea how stubborn that old man of ours can be at home. Especially with that temper of his.

Dialogues.Speaker: Anxious Young Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: At home, whatever he says goes. Not to mention he's also known in the field for being a wacko and a pain in the butt to get along. Musicians on the receiving end of his temper and harsh critiques are a common thing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Anxious Young Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My uncle became a renowned composer in the field at young age.

Dialogues.Speaker: Anxious Young Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't know what's gotten him worked up a few days ago after he saw a random news report.

Dialogues.Speaker: Anxious Young Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Everyone in the family couldn't talk him out of coming all the way here, and now he's just left me here...

Dialogues.Speaker: Anxious Young Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah. It's one of those boring rumor ghost stories. The kind that even kids wouldn't fall for.

Dialogues.Speaker: Anxious Young Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's headlines went something like: "Abandoned Theater in the Rain— A Piano Plays Without it's Performer."

Dialogues.Speaker: Anxious Young Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: *sigh* I think his age is finally catching up to him...

Options.PlotLineKey: I'll help you go look for him.

Dialogues.Speaker: Anxious Young Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Really? That would be great. No wonder my uncle always talks about how the people of Jinzhou are so kind and warm-hearted. Guess it's all true.

Dialogues.Speaker: Anxious Young Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I was really stuck between a rock and a hard place. If he saw me going after him, he'd freak out for sure.

Dialogues.Speaker: Anxious Young Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Plus with his heart condition and all... Thank you. As long as you can find him and make sure he's safe, then that's good enough for me!

Dialogues.Speaker: Girl Sheltering from the Rain
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Eek! You're a person!

Options.PlotLineKey: What were you expecting? A ghost?

Dialogues.Speaker: Girl Sheltering from the Rain
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hahaha. It's just that people usually don't visit these parts.

Dialogues.Speaker: Girl Sheltering from the Rain
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Here, I've got some room to share. You don't want to get wet.

Dialogues.Speaker: Girl Sheltering from the Rain
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Haha. Since you asked. How about you answer why you're here first?

Dialogues.Speaker: Girl Sheltering from the Rain
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're... looking for someone?

Dialogues.Speaker: Girl Sheltering from the Rain
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm... An elderly man...

Options.PlotLineKey: Seen anyone that fits the description?

Dialogues.Speaker: Girl Sheltering from the Rain
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've only been here for just a while. Haven't met anyone besides you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Girl Sheltering from the Rain
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This isn't a place for an old man to be wandering all by himself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Girl Sheltering from the Rain
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll come along and help you look for him if I have the time later.

Dialogues.Speaker: Girl Sheltering from the Rain
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh. It's nice meeting you. I'm a journalist from the Pioneer Association. You can call me Siran.

Dialogues.Speaker: Girl Sheltering from the Rain
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I came here to follow up on a news piece.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So you've heard of it? Did you read the full article?

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wow. The article only had a few lines in the magazine. I thought barely anyone noticed it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehe. In all honesty, I'm still just an intern.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I only came across the rumors by chance. And if everything goes well, this'll be my first formal investigative report!

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But my editor thinks I'm just wasting my time on some random rumors...

Options.PlotLineKey: Why are you so interested in these rumors?

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmph. You sure have a lot of questions to ask for a stranger.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's just my personal interest, that's all.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've only managed to get down here not long ago, and it started raining before I could get an investigation going.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But on a side note, I think I'm actually in luck. I remember from the rumors that the piano will go off whenever it starts to rain.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I just don't know for sure if we can hear it from here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Or maybe... we should walk around a bit?

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then again, I don't want to miss it for walking too far.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Huh? Listen. Do you hear that? You hear something faint coming from that direction?

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Maybe I'm just hearing things...

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How about we go together and head towards that direction?

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You can help me keep an ear out for the piano, and I'll help you keep an eye out for that old man of yours.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's safer if we both stay together, amirite?

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If anything happens out of the ordinary, we can look out for each other.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Great!

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey. Look over there. What are they doing here?

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This place sure grew in popularity in just one day...

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Could it be that they all came here after reading the article? It can't be...

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hiya. Are you also here to take cover from the rain?

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You...

Dialogues.Speaker: "Young Man"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sir! The performance is in less than four hours! I need to go over the piece for at least another rehearsal.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Middle-aged Man"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey, you've practiced it a thousand times already, what difference do you think it'll make?

Dialogues.Speaker: "Middle-aged Man"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We've got less than four hours to spare, why don't we make use of this time to go for a walk? Enjoy the scenery.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Middle-aged Man"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's your first time in Jinzhou, isn't it?

Dialogues.Speaker: "Young Man"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's exactly why I have to be more careful. Got to make a good first impression in front of the people of Jinzhou!

Dialogues.Speaker: "Young Man"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Besides, I know how confident you are. But I'm not like you.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Middle-aged Man"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's true that you and I are different, Arin. Your style is clearly more robust.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Middle-aged Man"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But sometimes you put yourself in much tension, which leaves yourself in a lack of harmony and enjoyment.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Middle-aged Man"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Jinzhou is a border city of Huanglong. The people here are tenacious and optimistic. Thus the music they create are also grand and majestic, full of vigor.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Middle-aged Man"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I believe it has something in common with your style. A staff told me that there's a record store not far from here, so I was thinking...

Dialogues.Speaker: "Young Man"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I understand your meaning, sir. It's all due to my lack of practise and confidence.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Young Man"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll work harder. Forgive me that I can't accompany you on this sightseeing.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Young Man"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll head back to the theater to practice and help you sort out the music sheets and the performance list for today.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Middle-aged Man"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Arin...

Dialogues.Speaker: "Middle-aged Man"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: *sigh* That kid... I can do it myself just fine.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: J... Joshua... It's Mr. Joshua!

Dialogues.Speaker: "Young Man"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sir! The performance is in less than four hours! I need to go over the piece for at least another rehearsal.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Middle-aged Man"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey, you've practiced it a thousand times already, what difference do you think it'll make?

Dialogues.Speaker: "Middle-aged Man"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We've got less than four hours to spare, why don't we make use of this time to go for a walk? Enjoy the scenery.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why... Why are they repeating the same conversation...?

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see... I see how it is...

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's Mr. Joshua's spirit!

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mr. Joshua's spirit is trapped inside this area... Trapped forever...

Options.PlotLineKey: What are you talking about, Siran?

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I... Mr. Joshua is the reason why I came here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Twenty years ago, he saved my life from a terrible accident...

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He saved me, by sacrificing himself! And I...

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: For all these years, I've been scared to come back here. Whenever I close my eyes, that terrible moment would show up inside my mind...

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It was until I heard the rumors. Whenever there is rainfall, the sound of Mr. Joshua's piano can be heard...

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That ghostly figure, is just as Mr. Joshua was in my memories!

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He must be trapped here. The sound of falling rain is the sound of his soul weeping... As he plays his music on and on...

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It must be his way of expressing his frustration. Frustrated at why I haven't come back to visit him after so many years... Why didn't I come free him...

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It has be his spirit! You have to help me! I need to find a way to save him!

Options.PlotLineKey: I don't think it's his spirit.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What do you mean?

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Retroact Rain?

Options.PlotLineKey: Retroact Rain can recreate images or events from the past.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see... I've only read about it in textbooks... Never actually seen one before...

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rain that falls invertedly back towards the sky, while creating illusions of past events in its area... After looking at it closely, the rain is really falling upstream...

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mr. Joshua... What we saw, was it really a mirage from the past?

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But... But the books say mirages that appear are completely random!

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why... Of all the times it could of happened. Why now? Why appear in front of me?

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It must be fate...

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you think I've gone crazy, you can just leave me if you want.

Options.PlotLineKey: That's not what I had in mind...

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm sorry. I'm getting a bit emotional. I didn't mean to get mad at you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I need to take some time alone, see if the mirage will appear again...

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you. I appreciate your understanding.

Options.PlotLineKey: I'll go take a look around.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Okay. Please be careful.

Options.PlotLineKey: I'll see if there are any clues in the records store.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you...

Dialogues.Speaker: "Joshua"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm... Pop music... Folk music... Classical...

Options.PlotLineKey: Rainwater leaking in. That explains the illusions in the store.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Little Girl"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh!

Dialogues.Speaker: "Little Girl"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey, mister! Did you want to buy this record too?

Dialogues.Speaker: "Joshua"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: *chuckle* It's fine. Go ahead, you can have it.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Little Girl"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Tee-hee. Thank you, mister.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Joshua"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Classical music. Quite the taste you have there, young girl.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Little Girl"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This one? Hehe, it is kind of hard for me...

Dialogues.Speaker: "Little Girl"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mother told me, i-it's best for me to build my musical senses with the harder ones from the start!

Dialogues.Speaker: "Little Girl"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My fingers hurt from all the practise, but I'll keep working hard!

Dialogues.Speaker: "Joshua"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Good for you, child. You know the importance of practise very well.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Joshua"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What do you think, mister? Mother is right, but I think sometimes there's other ways to choose music.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Little Girl"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh? Then how do you purpose you should choose?

Dialogues.Speaker: "Joshua"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm... For example... What kind of music do you usually like to listen to?

Dialogues.Speaker: "Joshua"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What kind of music makes you want to can't help but hum along whenver you hear it?

Dialogues.Speaker: "Joshua"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Or perhaps, the kind of music that makes you want to dance along to?

Dialogues.Speaker: "Little Girl"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Err...

Dialogues.Speaker: "Little Girl"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mother wouldn't be happy if I told her that...

Dialogues.Speaker: "Little Girl"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I know! Every time when we pass by the theater, the sound of drums and gongs!

Dialogues.Speaker: "Little Girl"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You know, those sounds are so lively! They always make me want to hop around along with them!

Dialogues.Speaker: "Joshua"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Haha, is that so? I also quite enjoy the sounds of percussion instruments of Jinzhou.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Joshua"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's a shame that I probably won't have the time to go to the theater and enjoy them myself this time.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Joshua"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In that case. Let's see here.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Joshua"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ahh, this one. "Collection of Traditional Percussion Music". I'm sure you'll like it.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Little Girl"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Woah!

Dialogues.Speaker: "Little Girl"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: B-But, Mother wouldn't buy me anything that's not piano-related.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Joshua"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see... It's okay, you can have it as a gift.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Little Girl"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can't. Mother told me I can't take things from strangers.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Joshua"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ahh, yes. Your mother is absolutely correct about that.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Joshua"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How about this, I'm sure you know about the performance at the theater tonight, yes?

Dialogues.Speaker: "Little Girl"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah! Mother is a fan. It's what we're visiting here for!

Dialogues.Speaker: "Joshua"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Perfect. Then I'll leave my signature on this record. After the performance, bring it with you and come to the backstage with your mother.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Joshua"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Think of it as a special gift for a fan. What is your name, young girl?

Dialogues.Speaker: "Little Girl"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, really? Thank you, mister! My name is Siran!

Dialogues.Speaker: "Joshua"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Okay, Siran. Here you go.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Joshua"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, would you look at the time. I still haven't found a gift for my assistant yet.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Joshua"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I look forward to seeing you tonight, little pianist.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How's it going over there for you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I think I've found something. Let's meet up at these coordinates after you're done.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There you are. Did you find anything?

Options.PlotLineKey: I saw a mirage of your childhood.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My... my childhood?

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You mean... The one when Mr. Joshua gave me the record...?

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is why... This is why so I'm afraid to go there.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've lost it... The record... Lost it when I was running for dear life. I don't know where. It's been long gone.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It was a record Mr. Joshua picked for me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If he knew that I lost it, I can't image how sad and disappointed he'd be.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's okay, you don't have to cheer me up.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's okay, you don't have to talk me out of it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The only thing that's on my mind right now is how to free Mr. Joshua's soul from this place.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Okay, gotta pull myself together.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh. It came to me while I was walking around earlier.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mr. Joshua mentioned in his memoirs that he liked to compose music at places where there's water.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I remember there's a body of water not far away, so I went to try my luck.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And lo and behold, I heard the piano playing again when I got near the water.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I don't know why, but the sound of that piece felt really faint, like it's coming from every direction, from the skies.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It was impossible to tell the direction it was coming from.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The area around the water is too wide for me do do a complete go-around in a short amount of time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's why I contacted you, hoping you could help me investigate.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thanks.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now, I'll go in this direction and you go the opposite. Meet back here in 15 minutes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Didn't find anything out of the ordinary on my side.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Strangely enough. The farther I go, the further away I seemed to be from the piano.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So I assumed the source is mostly likely towards your direction and hurried back.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Exiles? What are they doing here?

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What about the piano? Did you find the source?

Options.PlotLineKey: The Exiles were broadcasting the music.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What are the Exiles using Mr. Joshua's music for?

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What are they trying to get out of it? This doesn't make any sense.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You mean to tell me that the "Piano in the Rain"... is just a ghost story made up by the Exiles just to scare people away from their territory?

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You mean to tell me that the "Piano in the Rain"... is just a ghost story made up by the Exiles just to scare people away from their territory?

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So it's just an ordinary mirage... Not his lingering spirit.

Options.PlotLineKey: Why so persistent about Mr. Joshua's spirit?

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Persistent. Huh...?

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I don't know... maybe I am being too persistent.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then if it's not Mr. Joshua's spirit...

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If even his spirit's gone...

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How am I supposed to tell him I'm sorry?

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sorry that I quitted the piano and gave up on music.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sorry that I failed to take care of that record.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sorry that I ran away without even looking back at him.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm sorry... I was just...

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Huh?

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. I can hear it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It sounds pretty far away.

Options.PlotLineKey: Do you have a pair of binoculars?

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I do, let me find it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There! I see someone! Over there, right by the lake!

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Looks like... An old man?

Dialogues.Speaker: Elder
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Who are you? What do you want?

Dialogues.Speaker: Elder
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let go of me this instant.

Dialogues.Speaker: Elder
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I... I'm not trying anything dangerous. Just let me go.

Options.PlotLineKey: Your nephew asked me to come find you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Elder
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My nephew?

Dialogues.Speaker: Elder
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That fool of a child.

Dialogues.Speaker: Elder
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm in perfect health. What could possibly happen to me?

Options.PlotLineKey: Why were trying to go into the water?

Dialogues.Speaker: Elder
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What do you think I'm trying to do?

Dialogues.Speaker: Elder
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: See that over there? On the high ground.

Dialogues.Speaker: Elder
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It suddenly occurred to me that there was something over there.

Dialogues.Speaker: Elder
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And I must get it back...

Dialogues.Speaker: Elder
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Get your dirty paws off me. I just need to get it back. It's nothing to worry about.

Dialogues.Speaker: Elder
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Huh? My business is none of your concern, youngster.

Dialogues.Speaker: Elder
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You... *coughing*...

Dialogues.Speaker: Elder
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh. Look at you, young and everything. You feel so proud about yourself don't you...?

Dialogues.Speaker: Elder
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: W-well... Then I shall thank you in advance. It should be right on that platform. As for what it is you're looking for, you'll know when you see it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You found a book-like object, layered with dust and dirt. The few vague musical notes that can be made out reveal that it seems to be a piano score.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A piano faintly echoes in the rain, extremely difficult to make out the direction its coming from. Siran quickly takes out her recorder to record it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A piano faintly echoes in the rain, extremely difficult to make out the direction its coming from. Siran quickly takes out her recorder to record it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A piano faintly echoes in the rain, extremely difficult to make out the direction its coming from. Siran quickly takes out her recorder to record it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Elder
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. This is it. This is the one...

Dialogues.Speaker: Elder
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After 20 years, I'd thought it had completely rotten out...

Dialogues.Speaker: Elder
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It must be my mentor's spirit safekeeping it all this time...

Options.PlotLineKey: Could it be, you're Master Arin?

Dialogues.Speaker: Arin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So you've heard of my name from my nephew?

Dialogues.Speaker: Arin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: *cough* Thank you, young {Male=man;Female=lady}.

Dialogues.Speaker: Arin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You can go tell my nephew I'm fine.

Options.PlotLineKey: You must've came here for Mr. Joshua?

Dialogues.Speaker: Arin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You... you know of my mentor?

Dialogues.Speaker: Arin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait. Are you here because of that news article about the ghosts?!?! *coughing heavily*...

Dialogues.Speaker: Arin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How can I not be excited about this?

Dialogues.Speaker: Arin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So there are still people who remember my mentor. Just like I have.

Dialogues.Speaker: Arin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My dear mentor... Is your soul finally at rest?

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You described to Master Arin in detail the encounter with Mr. Joshua's mirage during the rain.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After hearing your story, Arin stared at the lake with a blank face and went silent for a long time, before finally burying his head into his hands, sobbing painfully.

Dialogues.Speaker: Arin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mr. Joshua... As you saw in the mirage, I wasn't at the record store with him.

Dialogues.Speaker: Arin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Nor was I at the theater for more practice as I had said.

Dialogues.Speaker: Arin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I came here instead, standing in the spot where I am now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Arin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With this piano score in my hands.

Dialogues.Speaker: Arin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Joshua would often stay next to large areas of water whenever he composed piano pieces.

Dialogues.Speaker: Arin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He would close his eyes, with a very peaceful smile on his face. He said he listens to the symphony of winds and water.

Dialogues.Speaker: Arin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I volunteered to be his assistant at the time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Arin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I became famous at a young age, so famous to a point where everyone praised that I was a musical genius which only appears once every hundred years.

Dialogues.Speaker: Arin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I cherished my title of a genius, but I didn't let go of my efforts, so inevitably I became successful.

Dialogues.Speaker: Arin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But I knew that no matter how talented I am, or how hard I practiced, there will always be a behemoth looking down at me, and a plethora of leading musicians that I cannot surpass at the time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Arin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So I volunteered to become Joshua's assistant. I hope to stand next to his side and learn from him at every moment. Thinking that one day I'll be able to surpass him.

Options.PlotLineKey: Having a competitive mindset may lead to misfortune.

Dialogues.Speaker: Arin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ha. You're quite perceptive for your age aren't you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Arin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's right, the more impatient I am, the more I feel inferior to him.

Dialogues.Speaker: Arin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How does he keep his composure all the time?

Dialogues.Speaker: Arin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why the casual attitude?

Dialogues.Speaker: Arin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why does he always tell me to be calm and relax?

Dialogues.Speaker: Arin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why can he just listen to the sound of water and winds, and have expressions of so much enjoyment? And can't I?

Dialogues.Speaker: Arin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After glossing over the piano score in my hands, looking at the dotted notes in his handwritings.

Dialogues.Speaker: Arin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A sudden urge of emotions that I couldn't even define flowed into my head.

Dialogues.Speaker: Arin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And I flung the score into the air with all my strength, turned my back and headed towards to the theater.

Dialogues.Speaker: Arin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I made up my mind that after the performance, I would request a formal resignation to my mentor.

Dialogues.Speaker: Arin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But then, halfway there, I heard a soul-shaking blare.

Dialogues.Speaker: Arin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The eerie howls... ground-shaking boomings of the theater collapsing... and the screams of people running for their lives...

Dialogues.Speaker: Arin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I was caught between the fleeing crowds, petrified as rescue workers dragged and pulled me away...

Dialogues.Speaker: Arin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After I was taken to a safety area, I desperately searched for my mentor among the survivors...

Dialogues.Speaker: Arin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So many years have passed, I know more than anyone that there was no chance Joshua could've survived.

Dialogues.Speaker: Arin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Since then, I can no long play again, so I became a composer.

Dialogues.Speaker: Arin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But when I saw that news, there's no doubt in my mind that his soul had made a return.

Dialogues.Speaker: Arin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He was calling out to me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Arin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh... Forgive me, it's just me getting old. Every time I think of the past, I always end up rattling on.

Dialogues.Speaker: Arin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I apologize for dragging you along in this woeful story of mine.

Dialogues.Speaker: Arin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I have to go back to the theater, with this music score, and finish the performance that was meant to be.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The entrance to the record store is blocked by thorns. I should find another way in.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Joshua"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, where did he run off to now? He said he'd be here for some practise.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Joshua"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I hope he isn't mad about what I said earlier.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Joshua"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I wonder if it'll give him a startle when I announce his upcoming first ever solo concert after his performance today. Haha.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Joshua"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, he'll be practising and getting ready for it all day long that's for sure.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Joshua"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Need to come up with a good way to persuade him to relax his mind and go feel the world more.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Joshua"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then again, no musician wouldn't have their share of practises when they were young. Some things will naturally come to understanding after a period of time.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Joshua"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh? If it isn't the little girl from the record store.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Joshua"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: *chuckle* Look at her waving her arms...

Dialogues.Speaker: "Joshua"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She really is a child full of energy... I hope she can carry her passion for music like she does now with her and grow up well.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Joshua"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Vitality of life...

Dialogues.Speaker: "Joshua"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The essence of music.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The clouds looming over the theater gradually dissipated, as sunlight shone down on its center.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Arin and Siran broke down in tears, watching the figure and the rain fade away slowly into the sunlight.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You walked up to them and took out a record that's been slit in two from your backpack. Handing them each a piece.

Dialogues.Speaker: Arin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Could this be...

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I met Mr. Joshua at the record store. He mention choosing a present for his student.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After twenty years, the present is finally in your hands.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And the record that I lost, I believe I have found it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Arin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Even if it isn't Joshua's spirit...

Dialogues.Speaker: Arin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This rain... our encounter, and you witnessing it all. These are all real...

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Would you perform again, Mr. Arin?

Dialogues.Speaker: Arin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: By all means.

Dialogues.Speaker: Arin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What about you? Would you like to enjoy a percussion performance together with me?

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah! Rover should come with us too.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fantastic, from this day forth. The three of us shall be known at the "Eternal Audience"!

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Great, it's starting to pour. Not worth getting all my gear soaked.

Options.PlotLineKey: Do you want to move on?

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm...

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We've been walking around this area for a while, and we haven't heard any more of that piano.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why don't we find a place to take shelter from the rain first and go over those recordings? See if there are any clues we can analyze.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Should we go back to where we were earlier?

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hidden in a secluded spot is an old recorder playing a piano piece. The sound is distorted with static, making it sounds somewhat eerie.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hidden in a secluded spot is an old recorder playing a piano piece. The sound is distorted with static, making it sounds somewhat eerie.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: On the top of the watchtower, you notice a beat-up recorder playing the same piano piece. Together with the two recorders in the middle of the lake surface and on the ground, a sound field is cleverly created . This must be what's giving the piano piece its "ghostly" surrounding sound.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As Arin opened the music score and placed it on the music desk, hands trembling, Siran's voice emerges from behind you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That piano... I can't believe it's still here...

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: May I know who you are, sir?

Dialogues.Speaker: Arin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You must be here for Joshua, same as this young {Male=man;Female=lady} I presume?

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I... I do miss Mr. Joshua dearly.

Dialogues.Speaker: Arin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, you've arrived just in time. Who could've imagined that a twenty-year-suspended performance would be greeted by two audiences.

Dialogues.Speaker: Arin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, yes, yes. How can I forget.

Dialogues.Speaker: Arin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If my mentor could see this now, he'd be deeply pleased.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mentor? Are you...

Dialogues.Speaker: Arin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's just how I refer to him. I was Joshua's... assistant. But nowadays I would rarely mention myself as his student.

Dialogues.Speaker: Arin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I don't deserve it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sir... I...

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've always thought that if I'm lucky enough to meet Mr. Joshua's relatives or those close to him, I should... I should...

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Express my apology...

Dialogues.Speaker: Arin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Apology?

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mr. Joshua... He... It was beacause of me... He..

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's okay.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That day, I came to the theater with my mother, and I was extremely excited for the performance.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I didn't know at the time that the person who gave me the record at the record store was the maestro Joshua that my mother had admired so much.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Before the performance, he came up on stage and kindly greeted the audience.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He said that the highly anticipated opening performance was to be performed by his beloved pupil. He joked how it was the student's first large public performance and he was a little nervous.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How the student was sharp and more talented than even himself, and everyone will fall in love with him and his performance.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then, out of nowhere, I heard strange noises above my head.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mr. Joshua and I were the first to notice the noises. We looked up at the ceiling almost at the same time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Before we knew... the sky came down on top of us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, it was... it was that monster.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It was still a time where knowledge of the TD's habits were limited, and the guidelines and restrictions placed on outdoor theater performances were not as strict as they are now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I had no idea what was happening. All I remember was being pushed out by my mother and just run.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I couldn't tell which direction I was going, rocks and debris were falling everywhere. Screams and sounds of panicking people running echoed behind me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And... and that deep snarl...

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just when I was at a loss, a large hand grabbed me from the shadows.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I wanted to scream, but then I found out that it was Mr. Joshua.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He covered my mouth and took me into a crack formed from collapsed concrete.

Dialogues.Speaker: Arin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Joshua... Joshua he...

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I don't know how long time had passed before the screams around us disappeared.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It was nothing but dead silence... All we could hear was the harsh breathing sound... The sound of a giant hoof stepping over rocks.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It was pacing...

Options.PlotLineKey: Like some kind of hunting behavior?

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It must be. We later realized that it must've heard us breathing, so it kept wandering around.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We waited, waiting to see if it'll find a new prey, praying for it to leave.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've long lost track of time, and rescue was still not coming. All I knew was that my lips were as dry as if they would crack at any moment, and my consciousness getting weak...

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mr. Joshua started gently patting me on the back, I could vaguely make out the rhythms. It was he debut piece.

Dialogues.Speaker: Arin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That piece... The one that's been floating around this place.

Options.PlotLineKey: He wanted you to stay awake.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But his rhythm started to slowed down.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He checked my pulse and stopped patting, like he'd made some kind of decision.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He opened my eyelids, told me that he's going carry me in his arms and leave our hideout together on his mark, and that all I needed to care about was to just run, run until I my legs would give out.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I was terrified, but I didn't want to die, I wanted to see my mother.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So I nodded in agreement.

Options.PlotLineKey: There was no way a little girl can outrun...

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mr. Joshua thought of it as well. He knew that it was impossible for us to outrun that monster. I'd never escape on my own.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He carried me in his arms and walked out of the debris. We held our breathes as he tiptoed forward...

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But just as we barely got out, we heard the monster's hastened footsteps darting toward us...

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mr. Joshua set me down on the ground and yelled - "Run!"

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And he rushed in the opposite direction...

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The sound of piano began to play, smooth like the flow of water, as the footsteps immediately turned in its direction...

Options.PlotLineKey: These creatures are naturally attracted to sound.

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes...

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Those sounds... those terrifying sounds...

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I didn't look back... Too afraid to look back...

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: All these years, I've been scared to look back, covering my eyes and ears... always running away...

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If it wasn't for me...

Dialogues.Speaker: Arin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's wonderful...

Dialogues.Speaker: Siran
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sir?

Dialogues.Speaker: Arin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So there was an audience there for Joshua's final performance after all.

Dialogues.Speaker: Arin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He dedicated his final piece... to you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Arin
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: His little audience.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The mirage gradually dissipated in the rain. The destroyed record store was in total mess, with fallen shelves lying everywhere and pieces of records scattered across the floor.
